gui

Class BoardGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.BoardGUI

  • public class BoardGUI
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates the display of the boards. The display uses GridPane layout to visually show the players' boards. Also manages the size and adding contents into the grid.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoardGUI(int gridsize, int gridwidth)
      The constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BoardGUI

        public BoardGUI(int gridsize,
                int gridwidth)
        The constructor. Creates the Grid displays depending on the indicated size in the parameters. Also sets the constraints and adjusts the sizes to accomodate for the window size.
        Parameters:
        gridsize - - an integer indicating what board size to create
        gridwidth - - an integer indicating the width the display of the board occupies in the window. (Includes the margins) This is a final value set on Settings class.

    • Method Detail

      • getBoardGrid

        public javafx.scene.layout.GridPane getBoardGrid()
        Returns:
        the GridPane instance of this board display

      • getGridSize

        public int getGridSize()
        Returns:
        the grid size of this board display

      • getGridWidth

        public int getGridWidth()
        Returns:
        the gridWidth (in pixels) of this board display. (Includes the margins)

      • getGridBlockSize

        public double getGridBlockSize()
        Returns:
        the pixel size of one block of the grid of this board display

      • getImage

        public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getImage(java.lang.String image)
        Creates an ImageView instance for the images that will be placed on each single block of the grid. This includes the image components of the ships, the images for misses, and the images for hits. This formats the images' sizes to fit the block size of the current grid.
        Parameters:
        image - - a string referencing an image
        Returns:
        an ImageView instance that will be placed in the grid blocks

      • addValuesFromArray

        public void addValuesFromArray(Player thisPlayer,
                               java.lang.String boardType)
        Reads an array that represents a player's board and creates the visual representation of it. Using the getImage() method, it adds the image representation of ships, hits and misses into the GridPane Layout display of the player's board. Ships are setup from shipArrays using setShipArrays method.
        Parameters:
        thisPlayer - - A player holding an array containing enum values of ships, hits and misses
        boardType - - a String indicating what type this GridPane represents. ("gameBoard" or "guessBoard"). In guessBoard, the ships are hidden

      • setShipArrays

        public void setShipArrays(Ship[] array,
                          BoardValue[][] boardArray)
        The ship images displayed are determined from the shipArrays of each player. Adding images for the ships in the board display is much more complex since front and back have different images and images have to be rotated when the ship is horizontal
        Parameters:
        array - - a Ship array containing a player's ships in his/her current gameboard
        boardArray - - An array of a player containg boardvalues.

      • addShipImage

        public void addShipImage(java.lang.String imgPath,
                         BoardValue[][] boardArray,
                         int row,
                         int col,
                         char orientation)
        Adds a specified ship image to a coordinate in the board display. Different images include the ShipHead, ShipBody, and ShipTail images are rotated if the ship orientation is horizontal
        Parameters:
        imgPath - - a String specifying what file image should be added into the board display
        boardArray - - An array of a player containg boardvalues.
        row - - an integer indicating the row where the ship image should be added
        col - - an integer indicating the column where the ship image should be added
        orientation - - a char indicating the orientation of the ship that is to be added into the board display
